subject: Apple's new privacy feature is changing the web
text:
August 2021 View in browser
Hi Simoo,
Can you believe August is almost over? Get ready for a bumper month of content, including the latest on Apple's controversial privacy changes, Managed WordPress hosting, and Steve Job's greatest ever speech.
Get inspired
STARTUP & BUSINESS
How Apple‚Äôs privacy updates impact small business
Email marketing is changing following Apple's iOS update, meaning small businesses can no longer track their customers' behavior so easily. Learn more about the updates and what you can do to minimize their impact.
Read More
STARTUP & BUSINESS
Energize your business for the rest of 2021
As 2021 rolls into its final quarter, see how you can reset your goals while looking after your well-being. You'll be in a great place to supercharge your business for the holiday season.
Read More
WORDPRESS
Ultimate guide to managed WordPress hosting
Getting a WordPress site up and running is serious business, from UX design, SEO to writing content. Discover an easier, optimized service: managed WordPress hosting.
Read More
You'll love this
TECHNOLOGY
One of the greatest speeches ever | Steve Jobs
Listen to the late Apple founder's speech at Stanford University in 2005, urging people to pursue their dreams and see opportunities in setbacks, and providing one of the most famous quotes of modern times.
Website of the month
INSPIRATIONAL
mohinviraj.com
Discover the teenage photographer Mohin Viraj Gandhi, whose visual storytelling beautifully captures people, places, and the natural world. Showing that you can achieve your dreams irrespective of your age.
Want to feature your website? Apply here.
I can accept failure. Everyone fails at something. But I can‚Äôt accept not trying.
Michael Jordan

This week's links üîó
UI & UX Design Tips
Learn UI & UX Design with practical byte-sized tips and in-depth articles from Jim Raptis.
Fast and Cheap Ways to Find UX Research Participants
Proven methods for finding research participants when you‚Äôre low on time or low on budget.
A Future of Design Without Designers?
I'm super interested in how the rise of automation and agentive technology may affect the role of the designer over the coming years. In this article I attempt to make sense of some of the current trends and outline one potential future (if we're not too careful).
Quick tip: Reviewing a design for accessibility
Reviewing designs for accessibility is a great way to help designers think more accessibly and to help developers implement more accessibly. We can use short checklists to help us make sure we haven't missed any big things.
An Interactive Guide to Keyframe Animations
CSS keyframe animations are incredibly flexible and powerful, but they‚Äôre also a bit weird. In this deep-dive tutorial, we'll learn how CSS keyframes work from the ground up, and see how to use them to build high-quality animations.

subject: Issue #471: Optimizing CSS Size and Performance, AVIF Image Format, Engaging Animations
text:
Issue #471 ‚Ä¢ September 1, 2021
view online version
          Refactoring CSS: Optimizing Size and Performance
      Adrian Bece covers CSS optimization strategies to optimize CSS file size, loading times, and render performance.
  Read more
  Decoding AVIF: Deep Dive With Cats and Imgproxy
      Polina Gurtovaya and Andy Barnov explain how is AVIF image format different from predecessors and how to start using it today with the help of a reliable and straightforward self-hosted image converter.
  Read more
      From Our Sponsor
          An All-Star Lineup‚Ä¶
      It‚Äôs rare to have so many of the world‚Äôs top experts together in one place. An Event Apart has hand-selected 15 of the world‚Äôs top experts that will inspire your creativity, add to your skill set, and increase your value.
  Join us online October 11‚Äì13 for Fall Summit 2021. Save $100 on any multi-day pass with promo code AEACSSW21.
  See the detailed three-day agenda and register now.
      Articles & Tutorials
          Stealing Game Animation Techniques to Engage Users
  Eli Penner shows how to create more engaging animations.
  Read more
  Building A Stepper Component
  Ahmad Shadeed explores different designs for a stepping component and explains how to implement each one in HTML and CSS.
  Read more
  Exploring the CSS Paint API: Blob Animation
  Temani Afif demonstrates how to create a blog animation using CSS Paint API.
  Read more
  I Bet You Don't Keep A Developer Journal: 3 Reasons You Should
  Simon Barker explains why you should keep a developer journal.
  Read more
  ARIA Spec for the Uninitiated: Part 1
  Gerard Cohen discusses the importance of familiarizing yourself with the official ARIA standard and points out some of the essential ARIA rules.
  Read more
      Promoted Link
            Sick of biased news?
  1440 provides a daily, impartial view of what‚Äôs happening in science, politics, business, culture, sports, and more, so you can form your own informed conclusions ‚Äî all in a 5-minute read.

  An online JSON formatter that produces human-readable but fairly compact output.

  Get inspired

  Happy coding,

  Smooth and Simple Page Transitions With the Shared Element Transition API
      Jake Archibald gives an introduction to the shared element transition API, which allows page transitions within single-page apps.
  Read more
      From Our Sponsor (via Paved)
          Free Chat/Messaging UI Kits for Your Website or App
      Stream Chat makes it easy to add a powerful messaging experience to any dev project, with free UI kit downloads and customizable components for 5 popular use cases: livestream chat, team collaboration, social messaging, customer support, and gaming.
  Try for free
      Articles & Tutorials
          Does Shadow DOM Improve Style Performance?
  Nolan Lawson explores the effects of shadow DOM on style performance.
  Read more
  The Big Gotcha With Custom Properties
  Chris Coyier explains the common misconception about Custom Properties.
  Read more
  CSS Pseudo Commas
  S. Shahriar explores some ways to spread list items into a sentence with proper formatting (punctuation and conjunction) using pseudo-elements.
  Read more
  Accessibility from the Ground Up
  Kitty Giraudel offers some advice on getting started with accessibility, so you consider it all throughout the project‚Äôs development lifecycle instead of at the end like usual.
  Read more
  Chrome DevTools: Better Accessibility Inspection With the Source Order Viewer
  Umar Hansa shows a simple tip on how to inspect source order using DevTools.
  Read more
      Promoted Link
            Sharpen your web design skills in just three days
  An Event Apart Online Together: Fall Summit 2021 is a three-day web design conference with an intense focus on digital design, UX, content, code, and more‚Äîfeaturing 15 in-depth sessions, Q&A with the speakers, and more. You‚Äôll get deep insights into where we are now and where we‚Äôre going next. Join us online October 11‚Äì13.
  See the agenda and register now.
      Tools
          Fiddly
  Fiddly is a tool to create beautiful and simple HTML pages from your Readme.md files.
  Check it out
  Blobbb Fun
  Blobbb is an online tool to create blob-like SVG shapes.
  Check it out
      Inspiration
          Pure CSS Akari 1A
      Aris Acoba created a stunning illustration using pure CSS.
  Get inspired
      Until Next Week
          Thanks for reading! If you find the content valuable, please consider supporting the newsletter on Patreon.
  Happy coding,
Zoran Jambor

subject: Issue 317
text:
CSS LAYOUT NEWS
Issue 317
BY RACHEL ANDREW ‚Äì 25 AUG 2021 ‚Äì VIEW ONLINE ‚Üí
This week the majority of the articles I've collected are about browsers and rendering engines. I do enjoy the fact that so much more browser work is being done in the open these days, with designers and developers being asked for their feedback. So do give that feedback, if you spot something that you have opinions on, it may well make a difference to an emerging part of the web platform.
Also this week, I dug out a copy of the first edition of my book, The CSS Anthology. It included solutions to problems such as, "Some of my content is appearing and disappearing in Internet Explorer 6", and, "How do I hide CSS from Netscape 4?" We have come a long way since 2004.
Rachel Andrew
News
Compat2021: Improving CSS Grid compatibility with GridNG
An update on the work being done by Microsoft on GridNG to reimplement CSS Grid Layout. Details of the bugfixes that are in Edge and Chrome 93, plus a hint that subgrid is on the way. Very exciting!
Online meetup about OpenUI
CSS Cafe presents Melanie Richards & Greg Whitworth - Open UI: Solving a Multi-Decade Problem. Signup and watch online, I'm hoping there will be a recording as it is right in the middle of West Coast/Europe crossover time, where all my meetings live.
Learn
Key data structures and their roles in RenderingNG
Another deep dive into RenderingNG. This is the third in a series of posts on developer.chrome.com digging into RenderingNG, I've been editing these, and definitely know more about how the browser renders a webpage than I did before!
Scrollbar reflowing
A reminder to test your sites with scrollbars showing (if you use a Mac) as otherwise you may not spot scrollbar-induced layout shifts.
Why WebKit supports AVIF but Safari does not
An explanation of why Safari does not support the AVIF image format.
We speak your language: three days of learning, CSS, design, and more
Join us online October 11‚Äì13 for An Event Apart Online Together: Fall Summit 2021, a three-day conference with an intense focus on digital design, UX, content, code, and more.
Fall Summit 2021 features fifteen in-depth sessions, each followed by a live, moderated Q&A session with the speaker, plus a special session at the end of each day.
Spanning the spectrum from climate-conscious development to design beyond the screen, and from advanced CSS to inclusive design and development, this three-day online web design conference will give you deep insights into where we are now, and where things are going next.
CSS Layout subscribers can save $100 off any multi-day pass with promo code: AEACSSL21
Don‚Äôt miss out‚Äîsee our detailed three-day schedule and register today!
This newsletter is published by Rachel Andrew Ltd. Registered Office: The Dutch Barn Bremhill Grove Farm, East Tytherton, Chippenham, Wiltshire, England, SN15 4LX
CSS Layout News ¬© 2021 ‚Äì Unsubscribe

subject: Issue 318
text:
CSS LAYOUT NEWS
Issue 318
BY RACHEL ANDREW ‚Äì 01 SEP 2021 ‚Äì VIEW ONLINE ‚Üí
Last week I had a new garden office installed. It's basically a posh shed, but I'm hoping less spidery than my actual garden shed. In sorting out the room I currently work from I found my copy of The CSS Anthology, 1st edition. It included information about the IE6 peekaboo bug, and how to hide CSS from Netscape 4. That book was written at a time when many people still used tables for layout, and a raft of issues made CSS, for layout in particular, really hard work.
Enjoy the collection of links this week, and assuming the electrician shows up next week will come to you from the bottom of the garden.
Rachel Andrew
News
Chrome 93
Chrome 93 is out. This release lands the new alignment values for Flexbox, explained in this post. This also marks the start of Chrome moving to a 4-week release cycle.
CSS Master Third Edition
I was technical editor for this excellent book from Tiffany B. Brown, which gives a thorough overview of CSS in an easy-to-follow format.
Learn
Exploring the CSS Paint API: Blob Animation
Another article about the CSS Paint API, this time looking at creating an animated blob.
The Fixed Background Attachment Hack
A dig into an issue you might have experienced with fixed backgrounds, along with some workarounds.
Starting a design with accessibility
Tips to help in considering accessibility before beginning to design a site or application.
Interesting
Spicy Sections
Some members of the OpenUI Community Group are experimenting with the idea of tabs in HTML. Here, Hidde tries out the experimental custom element, and explains more about the aims of the proposal.
This newsletter is published by Rachel Andrew Ltd. Registered Office: The Dutch Barn Bremhill Grove Farm, East Tytherton, Chippenham, Wiltshire, England, SN15 4LX
CSS Layout News ¬© 2021 ‚Äì Unsubscribe
